I believe the same modifications will be needed as well for the same class in the v1.3 package
org.kie.dmn.backend.marshalling.v1_3.xstream. MarshallingUtils
Thank you for pointing that out! Fixed and updated.

For a next iteration, we could think how to go beyond the need of this function.
I understand the need of it currently, and why it's invoked in an eval().
I am wondering IF we had an utility method on all the model's object which returned their parent Definitions if that would have solved.
What do you think?

Thank you for pointing this out. The problem was that ksession has only Definitions object from "DMNImports" entry-point. The rule wants to evaluate all InformationRequirement, KnowledgeRequirement etc. objects inside the Definitions. I wasn't able to write a nice rule with nested "from" so I ended up to write the function. So rather than

an utility method on all the model's object which returned their parent Definitions

, inversely,

an utility method on Definitions to return all descendant model objects.

would help to write the rule easier, I think.
@tarilabs  Shall I file a JIRA for the improvement? Or you meant that it can be improved during this PR work?

let's file for improvement in another JIRA, imho.
Another viable alternative, is a static function which does as you say, would take as input an Definitions and will produce as output all children. This way, it can be used a source in a from node in the DRL rule. What do you think? :)
Thanks, yes, it sounds good. I filed a JIRA for that https://issues.redhat.com/browse/DROOLS-5232
